    Some review articles in low-energy nuclear physics (mostly)

    • List of reviews on nuclear forces and their renormalization.
    • List of reviews on reactions theory.
    • List of reviews on many-body methods.
    • List of reviews on random matrix theory.

    Exploration of the drip lines

    • T. Otsuka, A. Gade, O. Sorlin, T. Suzuki, and Y. Utsuno
      Evolution of shell structure in exotic nuclei
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 92, 015002 (2020) article
    • A. Volya, and V. Zelevinsky
      Continuum shell model and nuclear physics at the edge of stability
      Phys. Atom. Nucl. 77, 969 (2014) article
    • M. Thoennessen
      Exploring new neutron-rich nuclei with the facility for rare isotope beams
      Nucl. Data Sheets 118, 85 (2014) article
    • M. Thoennessen
      Current status and future potential of nuclide discoveries
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 76, 056301 (2013) article
    • K. Heyde
      Unveiling the many facets of the atomic nucleus: from Rutherford to exotic nuclei
      Phys. Scr. T 152, 014006 (2013) article
    • C. Forsséen, G. Hagen, M. Hjorth-Jensen, W. Nazarewicz, and J. Rotureau
      Living on the edge of stability, the limits of the nuclear landscape
      Phys. Scr. T 2013, 014022 (2013) article
    • T. Baumann, A. Spyrou, and M. Thoennessen
      Nuclear structure experiments along the neutron drip line
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 75, 036301 (2012) article
    • O. Sorlin, and M. -G. Porquet
      Nuclear magic numbers: New features far from stability
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 61, 602 (2008) article
    • M. Thoennessen
      Reaching the limits of nuclear stability
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 67, 1187 (2004) article
    • B. Jonson
      Light dripline nuclei
      Phys. Rep. 389, 1 (2004) article
    • P. G. Hansen
      Nuclear structure at the drip-lines
      Nucl. Phys. A 553, 89 (1993) article

    Exotic decay modes

    • M. Pfützner
      Particle radioactivity of exotic nuclei
      Phys. Scr. T 152, 014014 (2013) article
    • M. Pfützner, M. Karny, L. V. Grigorenko, and K. Riisager
      Radioactive decays at limits of nuclear stability
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 84, 567 (2012) article
    • B. Blank, and M. Płoszajczak
      Two-proton radioactivity
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 71, 046301 (2008) article

    Monopole and multipole decomposition of the shell model Hamiltonian

    • M. Dufour, and A. P. Zuker
      Realistic collective nuclear Hamiltonian
      Phys. Rev. C 54, 1641 (1996) article
    • A. P. Zuker, and M. Dufour
      Separation of the monopole contribution to the nuclear Hamiltonian
      arXiv (1995) arXiv

    Collective phenomena

    shape coexitence

    • K. Heyde, and J. L. Wood
      Shape coexistence in atomic nuclei
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 83, 1467 (2011) article
    • K. D. Launey, T. Dytrych, and J. P. Draayer
      Symmetry-guided large-scale shell-model theory
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 89, 101 (2016) article
    • K. D. Launey, A. Mercenne, and T. Dytrych
      Nuclear dynamics and reactions in the ab initio symmetry-adapted framework
      Annu. Rev. Nucl. Part. Sci. 71, 253 (2021) article
    • M. A. Caprio, P. Maris, J. P. Vary, and R. Smith
      Collective rotation from ab initio theory
      Int. J. Mod. Phys. E 24, 1541002 (2015) article
    • J. P. Elliot
      Collective motion in the nuclear shell model. I. Classification schemes for states of mixed configurations
      Proc. R. Soc. Lond. A 245, 128 (1958) article
    • J. P. Elliot
      Collective motion in the nuclear shell model. II. The introduction of intrinsic wave-functions
      Proc. R. Soc. Lond. A 245, 562 (1958) article
    • N. Tsunoda, T. Otsuka, K. Takayanagi, N. Shimizu, T. Suzuki, Y. Utsuno, S. Yoshida, and H. Ueno
      The impact of nucleat shape on the emergence of the neutron dripline
      Nature 587, 66 (2020) article
    • S. Frauendorf
      Spontaneous symmetry breaking in rotating nuclei
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 73, 463 (2001) article
    • P. A. Butler, and W. Nazarewicz
      Intrinsic reflection asymmetry in atomic nuclei
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 68, 349 (1996) article
    • M. C. M. O’Brien, and C. C. Chancey
      The Jahn-Teller effect: An introduction and current review
      Am. J. Phys. 61, 688 (1993) article

    clustering

    • K. Kravvaris, and A. Volya
      Clustering in structure and reactions using configuration interaction techniques
      Phys. Rev. C 100, 034321 (2019) article
    • W. von Oertzen, M. Freer, and Y. Kanada-En’yo
      Nuclear clusters and nuclear molecules
      Phys. Rep. 432, 43 (2006) article
    • M. Freer
      The clustered nucleus–cluster structures in stable and unstable nuclei
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 70, 2149 (2007) article
    • M. Freer, H. Horiuchi, Y. Kanada-En’yo, D. Lee, and Ulf-G. Meißner
      Microscopic clustering in light nuclei
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 90, 035004 (2018) article

    Nuclear astrophysics

    • M. R. Mumpower, R. Surman, G. C. McLaughlin, and A. Aprahamian

      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 86, 86 (2016) article
    • E. G. Adelberger, et al.
      Solar fusion cross sections. II. The $pp$ chain and CNO cycles
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 83, 195 (2011) article
    • C. A. Bertulani, and A. Gade
      Nuclear astrophysics with radioactive beams
      Phys. Rep. 485, 195 (2010) article
    • H. Grawe, K. Langanke, and G. Martínez-Pinedo
      Nuclear structure and astrophysics
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 70, 1525 (2007) article
    • A. Aprahamian, K. Langanke, and M. Wiescher
      Nuclear structure aspects in nuclear astrophysics
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 54, 535 (2005) article

    Open quantum systems (OQS)

    • N. Moiseyev
      Quantum theory of resonances: calculating energies, widths and cross-sections by complex scaling
      Phys. Rep. 302, 212 (1998) article
    • L. Fonda, G. C. Ghirardi, and A. Rimini
      Decay theory of unstable quantum systems
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 41, 587 (1978) article

    Formal aspects

    • O. Civitarese, and M. Gadella

      Phys. Rep. 396, 41 (2004) article

    Complex-scaling methods

    • T. Myo, Y. Kikuchi, H. Masui, and K. Katō

      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 79, 1 (2014) article
    • Y. K. Ho
      The method of complex coordinate rotation and its applications to atomic collision processes
      Phys. Rep. 99, 1 (1983) article

    Phenomena

    • N. Auerbach, and V. Zelevinsky
      Super-radiant dynamics, doorways and resonances in nuclei and other open mesoscopic systems
      Rep. Prog. Phys. 74, 106301 (2011) article
    • A. E. Miroshnichenko, S. Flach, and Y. S. Kivshar

    Few-body physics, halos

    • T. Frederico, A. Delfino, L. Tomio, and M. T. Yamashita
      Universal aspects of light halo nuclei
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 67, 939 (2012) article
    • I. Bloch, J. Dalibard, and W. Zwerger
      Many-body physics with ultracold gases
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 80, 885 (2008) article
    • E. Braaten, and H. -W. Hammer
      Universality in few-body systems with large scattering length
      Phys. Rep. 428, 259 (2006) article
    • M. V. Zhukov, B. V. Danilin, D. V. Fedorov, J. M. Bang, I. J. Thompson, and J. S. Vaagen
      Bound state properties of Borromean halo nuclei: $^{6}\text{He}$ and $^{11}\text{Li}$
      Phys. Rep. 231, 151 (1993) article
    • D. L. Canham, and H. -W. Hammer
      Universal properties and structure of halo nuclei
      Eur. Phys. J. A 37, 367 (2008) article
    • I. Tanihata, H. Savajols, and R. Kanungo
      Recent experimental progress in nuclear halo structure studies
      Prog. Part. Nucl. Phys. 68, 215 (2013) article
    • A. S. Jensen, K. Riisager, D. V. Fedorov, and E. Garrido
      Structure and reactions of quantum halos
      Rev. Mod. Phys. 76, 215 (2004) article

    historical halo

    • P. G. Hansen, and B. Jonson
      The neutron halo of extremely neutron-rich nuclei
      Europhys. Lett. 4, 409 (1987) article
    • I. Tanihata, H. Hamagaki, O. Hashimoto, Y. Shida, N. Yoshikawa, K. Sugimoto, O. Yamakawa, T. Kobayashi, and N. Takahashi

      Phys. Rev. Lett. 55, 2676 (1985) article
